issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

labels.description: Filters devs cannot reproduce this issue

labels.name: A: Waiting for data
labels.description: Waiting for more information from the user

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.iqiyi.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.iqiyi.com%2F) ### Comment > 在https://www.iqiyi.com/封面右键元素里找到播放链接，如果AdGuard开启下面2项功就算把问题域名设为白名单世 > 不能解决问题 > 1,【"AdGuard URL跟踪过滤器 > 通过从URL中删除跟踪参数来增强隐私的过滤器。” > 2."Legitimate URL Shortener > 自动从URL中删除不必要的"$'和'&'值，使它们更容易从URL栏中复制并作为链接 > 粘贴到其他地方。已包含在Dandelion Sprout的防骚扰列表中。】" > 会导致爱奇艺视频网站不能正常打开。关闭AdGuārd打开元素里面复制的链接就正 > 常打开 > 这是我最喜欢的2个功希望能修复规则，同时网站也是最知名的视频网站 > > > > Find the playback link in the element.If AdGuard enables the > following two functions,even if the problem domain is > whitelisted,it cannot solve the problem > 1.AdGuard URL Tracking Filter > A privacy enhancing filter that removes tracking parameters > from URLs > 2.Legal URL Shorter > Automatically remove unnecessary '$and'&'values from > URLs,making them easier to copy from the URL bar and > paste as links elsewhere.Already included in Dandelion > Sprout's anti harassment list > It will cause the iQiyi video website to not open properly. > Close AdGuard and open the copied link in the element to > open it normally > These are my favorite 2 features that I hope can fix the rules. > and the website is also the most well-known video website ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/i6xv2xilvmgc0cww48kkcssws44g08ggu79dc5zg2g.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/3gtx5niuu0mcs8k0c4kwo4wgo40gcgw3o5jib8afd4.png?nc=1)

comment.body:
Not reproduced on my end.
Try to update the filters (wait almost one minute there), clear browser data, restart it, open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).

issue.title: imap-mail.outlook.com

labels.name: A: Cannot reproduce
labels.description: Filters devs cannot reproduce this issue

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [http://imap-mail.outlook.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fimap-mail.outlook.com)
### Comment
> Adguard public DNS is blocking outlook's imap/smtp servers (imap-mail.outlook.com | smtp-mail.outlook.com).  The issue can be seen when connecting to a network that has the dns configured with 94.140.14.14/94.140.15.15.  When connected to a network with that dns, apps such as gmail on android, are unable to send or receive any new emails.  If you disconnect from the network with that DNS emails will begin syncing again.  This is also an issue when running on mobile networks and using the private network dns.adguard-dns.com on the device.  If you remove the private network, syncing begins again.

### Screenshots
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 1 </summary>

  ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/s2dd9mof15c808ko0080c88wo40wgsg2wslr3pyhh4.png?nc=1)

</details>

Information | Value

issue.title: www.youku.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.youku.com/ku/webhome](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youku.com%2Fku%2Fwebhome) ### Comment > The website issue has recently occurred > Website 404 due to incorrect filtering rules when redirecting videos > I have received a successful feedback regarding the launch of the iQiyi website > AdGuard URL Tracking filter > Legitimate URL Shortener > The feedback that caused the website to fail to redirect was that I reinstalled the plugin and turned off all functions. Even after enabling only the above functions, I still couldn't redirect, so I had to turn off and redirect > I found during testing that if I open all the filtered content on this website, the plugin crashes and needs to be reinstalled. I have triggered it about 8 times, and I only open it > AdGuard URL Tracking filter > Legitimate URL Shortener > These two items, as well as the forced activation of Chinese language filtering without any other filtering, will also work well. If the plugin crashes and needs to be reinstalled, the probability is very small ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/jl6xj8kuw8ow4g8ggc80c4sook00sko773fxmam8mo.png?nc=1)

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://www.tv4play.se/video/445599f40f8e57d56742/avsnitt-34-robinson-buren](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.tv4play.se%2Fvideo%2F445599f40f8e57d56742%2Favsnitt-34-robinson-buren) ### Comment > During all videos on www.tv4play.se I get video ads at intervals. comment.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.youku.com/ku/webhome](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youku.com%2Fku%2Fwebhome) ### Comment > The problem I encountered is more serious than yours, it is 404, and when I try again, AdGuard crashes again, can you open this page to prove 2 points, the bad news is that you need to use a Chinese IP to watch the video, the good news is that this has nothing to do with the problem I reported and does not affect you to troubleshoot the problem. You have to turn on the filter I specified to verify the result, click on the video because the URL filter rule setting causes the deletion of important parameters and the connection access fails Redirect to https://www.youku.com/index/y404?type=urlInvalid&detail=, which is different from ad element filtering I hope that the URL rule filtering aspect can also adapt to the whitelist strategy, which is not currently enforced by the whitelist constraints, Or there are more flexible custom rule performance, because this is the second time I've reported this kind of problem, and many people may not find a reason for it to use the whitelist to temporarily transition and wait for subsequent feedback ### Screenshots

### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.pinterest.com/search/pins/?q=guts&rs=typed](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.pinterest.com%2Fsearch%2Fpins%2F%3Fq%3Dguts%26rs%3Dtyped) ### Comment > Pinterest has disabled the ability to hit "enter" when typing a search when adguard or any ad-blocking extension is enabled. > > 1. Ensure adguard enabled > 2. Type a search term in the search bar (must be logged in) > 3. Hit enter > 4. The page will not return any search > > Pinterest has recently sent pop-ups telling users to disable adblockers and this is the punishment. Also, they kind of suck right now. > > Thank you guys in advance. ### Screenshots

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: Youtube started showing video ads again - May 27, 2025
issue.body: ### Prerequisites - [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml); - [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue; - [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date; - [x] Browser version is up-to-date; - [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue. ### What product do you use? AdGuard for Safari ### AdGuard version AdGuard for Safari Version 1.11.22 (build 347, CT 2.0.44) ### What type of problem have you encountered? Missed ads or ad leftovers ### Which browser(s) do you use? Safari ### Which device do you use? Desktop ### Where is the problem encountered? youtube.com ### Ad Blocking AdGuard Base filter ### Privacy AdGuard Tracking Protection filter ### Social Widgets AdGuard Social Media filter ### Annoyances AdGuard Annoyances filter ### Security _No response_ ### Other _No response_ ### DNS filters _No response_ ### Language-specific _No response_ ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? _No response_ ### Add your comment and screenshots I am reporting https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d6887944-583e-417e-b12e-07689057547b an issue with [YouTube.com](http://youtube.com/) video ads that appear at the beginning of any video. Please note this is a very recent regression that started on May 27, 2025 and prior to that all video ads were blocked. The behaviour is different on iPhone where mobile version of YouTube in Safari is used. In that case all ads are blocked as before. In desktop Safari, with latest AdGuard and all most up to date filters, the behaviour is different for logged in case vs viewing without logging in. If I don't log in to my account, no video ads are displayed. When clicking on any video, it plays immediately with no spinner and no ads. If I do log in, the behaviour changes: Once you click on any video, the page loads and video does not play immediately. Initially, spinner is displayed for quite long time and after that an ad is displayed. You have an option to skip the ad and then the video plays normally. Please note that Brave Browser with its default ad blocker does not display any ads and videos start immediately. Firefox with uBlock Origin also works as normal. iPad Safari (latest iPadOS, Adguard Pro and filters up to date) also shows the same experience and desktop Safari. Interestingly engough Brave Browser on iPad does block all ads as before and video startup experience is different. Videos play immediately and no ads are shown. Here is some relevant systems info: macOS 15.5 (24F74), Safari Version 18.5 (20621.2.5.11.8) with AdGuard for Safari Version 1.11.22. iPadOS 18.5 with AdGuard Pro for iOS version 4.5.10 (1029) ### Privacy - [x] I agree to follow this condition

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

comment.body:
> With your settings I can't reproduce.

@Alex-302 Appears to be a problem with the base filter or something with adguard itself. I tested it and the only thing I have enabled is base and I get the same issue although it takes much less time to show. When enabled the page lags and locks up although less badly but when I select "reload without content blockers", the page works as it should. You can refer to the screen recording below. 


Also I have to use "reload without content blockers" as for some reason, using the extension and disabling "enabled on this website" doesn't seem to work and the issue is still present so I don't know if this is a filter problem or an issue with the extension itself.
